access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: A one-page patient access request form titled 'Request to Review/Receive Medical Information' with a parallel online web form for electronic submission.

red_flags: Witness signature required on the form — HIPAA does not require witness signatures for patient access requests, creating an unnecessary barrier especially for rural patients filling out the form at home.
Reason for request appears mandatory — the form presents reason checkboxes without indicating they are optional, though HIPAA does not require patients to justify their access request.
bright_spots: KRS 422.317 free-copy disclosure printed directly on the form — unusually transparent for a critical access hospital.
Email offered as a delivery option alongside fax, mail, and pick-up — forward-thinking for a 25-bed rural facility.
Parallel online web form at /Release-of-Health-Form provides electronic submission — rare for a critical access hospital.
Single-page form with no legal boilerplate — approachable and quick to complete.

findability.rationale: Rubric level 3: requires moderate effort — the PDF is not linked from any navigable page on the website and was found only via targeted web search; the web form may be more discoverable but was not confirmed linked from navigation.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Rubric level 4: mostly digital with one gap — the PDF itself is flat/non-fillable (print-and-handwrite), but the parallel online web form provides a fully digital submission pathway, and email delivery is available.

content_design.rationale: Rubric level 4: well-organized single page with plain language, logical flow, and clear checkbox options; minor issues include the witness line and reason-for-request field that add slight confusion.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Rubric level 4: patient access is clearly accommodated — the form is titled 'Request to Review/Receive Medical Information' with 'self' listed first, though it serves multiple purposes (self, child, other) without differentiated instructions.

compliance.rationale: Rubric level 3: some requirements that may go beyond what the law requires — the witness signature requirement has no basis in HIPAA for patient access, and the reason-for-request field appears mandatory despite HIPAA not requiring justification; partially offset by the KRS 422.317 free-copy disclosure.

overall.summary: Wayne County Hospital provides a patient-centered access form with an unusually strong online web form alternative and transparent fee disclosure, but is held back by a witness signature requirement and moderate findability challenges.
